dodInstructions.title: Cybersecurity
dodInstructions.description: Establishes policy and assigns responsibilities for implementing cybersecurity within the DoD information enterprise
relatedNistControls: All AC, IA, SC, SI, AU controls
dodInstructions.applicability: All DoD information systems including cloud platforms

controlMappings.requirement: Establish, maintain, and review information system accounts
Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources
Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between interconnected systems
Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users which are necessary to accomplish assigned tasks
Establish and document usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of remote access allowed
Monitor and control communications at the external boundary of the system and at key internal boundaries within the system
Protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information
Implement FIPS-validated or NSA-approved cryptography
Protect the confidentiality and integrity of information at rest
Identify the types of events that the system is capable of logging

Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes what type of event occurred, when, where, the source, the outcome, and the identity of any individuals or subjects associated with the event
Review and analyze information system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity
Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion
Provide audit record generation capability for the event types the system is capable of auditing
Uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users (or processes acting on behalf of organizational users)
Manage information system authenticators by verifying, as part of the initial authenticator distribution, the identity of the individual, group, role, or device receiving the authenticator
Uniquely identify and authenticate non-organizational users or processes acting on behalf of non-organizational users
Develop, document, and maintain under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the information system
Establish and document configuration settings for information technology products employed within the information system using security configuration checklists
Configure the information system to provide only essential capabilities
Identify, report, and correct information system flaws
Monitor the information system to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks, unauthorized local, network, and remote connections

dodInstructions.title: Risk Management Framework (RMF) for DoD IT
dodInstructions.description: Implements the Risk Management Framework (RMF) for all DoD information technology, including cloud and weapon systems
dodInstructions.applicability: All DoD IT systems requiring ATO

controlMappings.requirement: Develop, document, and disseminate a security assessment and authorization policy
Develop a security assessment plan that describes the scope of the assessment including security controls and control enhancements under assessment
Develop a plan of action and milestones for the information system to document the planned remedial actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies
Assign a senior-level executive or manager as the authorizing official
Develop a continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring in accordance with the organization-defined continuous monitoring strategy
Conduct an assessment of risk, including the likelihood and magnitude of harm, from the unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction of the information system
Monitor information system security alerts and advisories and take appropriate actions in response
Ensure that the organization-wide risk management strategy is implemented consistently across the organization

dodInstructions.title: Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) and Public Key (PK) Enabling
dodInstructions.description: Establishes policy for PKI implementation and CAC/PIV credential usage

controlMappings.requirement: Implement multifactor authentication for network access to privileged accounts using PKI credentials
Accept and electronically verify Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials
For PKI-based authentication, validate certifications by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor
Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of information and detect changes to information during transmission
Issue public key certificates under an appropriate certificate policy or obtain public key certificates from an appropriate service provider

dodInstructions.title: Cyberspace Workforce Management
dodInstructions.description: Establishes policy and assigns responsibilities for management of the DoD cyberspace workforce

controlMappings.requirement: Provide security awareness training to information system users as part of initial training for new users and when required by system changes
Provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities
Assign a risk designation to all organizational positions and establish screening criteria for individuals filling those positions
Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to the information system

dodInstructions.title: Security Categorization and Control Selection for National Security Systems
dodInstructions.description: Provides security control overlays for classified national security systems

controlMappings.requirement: Limit the number of external network connections to the information system
Deny network communications traffic by default and allow network communications traffic by exception
Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and detect unauthorized modifications of information at rest
Enforce physical access authorizations by verifying individual access authorizations before granting access to the facility
Monitor physical access to the information system to detect and respond to physical security incidents
Use cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions

impactLevels.name: Impact Level 2 - DoD Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) Low
impactLevels.description: Systems processing low-sensitivity CUI with limited impact if compromised

azureConfigurations.networking: Public endpoints allowed with NSG restrictions

impactLevels.name: Impact Level 4 - DoD CUI Moderate
impactLevels.description: Systems processing CUI with moderate impact if compromised

impactLevels.name: Impact Level 5 - DoD CUI High / Secret
impactLevels.description: Systems processing high-sensitivity CUI or classified information up to Secret

impactLevels.name: Impact Level 6 - Classified Secret / Top Secret
impactLevels.description: Systems processing classified information at Secret or Top Secret levels

azureConfigurations.networking: Dedicated isolated network, no internet connectivity
azureConfigurations.region: Secret/Top Secret regions only (Azure Government Secret)

networkRequirements: No public IP addresses on VMs
Private endpoints for all PaaS services
Network Security Groups with default deny

azureImplementation.virtualNetwork: Dedicated VNet with no internet gateway
azureImplementation.subnets: Separate subnets for each tier with NSGs
azureImplementation.privateEndpoints: Required for Storage, SQL, Key Vault, etc.

networkRequirements: No connection to internet or commercial networks
Dedicated cross-domain solutions for controlled transfers
Continuous monitoring of all network flows

azureImplementation.access: Cleared personnel with physical access controls
